metadata.title: CVE-2024-3096 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
password_verify can erroneously return true, opening ATO risk

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-cgi - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-cli - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-common - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-curl - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-dba - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-enchant - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-fpm - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16

php8.1-gmp - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-imap - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-interbase - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16

php8.1-mbstring - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-mysql - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-odbc - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-opcache - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-pgsql - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-phpdbg - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16

php8.1-readline - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16

php8.1-sqlite3 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-sybase - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16
php8.1-tidy - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16

php8.1-xsl - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1ubuntu2.16').
